intro: Alysicarpus glumaceus, commonly known as the hairy sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsules that contain several seeds, and it is often found in disturbed soils. Alysicarpus glumaceus is used in traditional medicine and has potential applications in herbal remedies.
